reason: Using floating-point variables for integer inputs causes precision errors.
Looping up to b is computationally infeasible for large values.
out-of-bounds array access when initializing j to M instead of M-1
initial socket count should be 1, not a
loop condition incorrectly starts with first =a instead of 1
Incorrect divisibility check; should be a[i] % a[j] == 0 instead of a[j] % a[j] == 0
